category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Arithmetic
sub_categories.description: Master arithmetic operations, number theory, and mathematical problem-solving techniques.

exercises.title: Advanced Number Theory
exercises.description: Solve complex number theory problems and mathematical proofs.

tasks.title: Euler's Totient Function
tasks.question:
Implement Euler's Totient Function φ(n) to count numbers coprime to n.

Your function should:

  • Calculate φ(n) for any positive integer n
  • Use prime factorization for efficiency
  • Handle large numbers efficiently
  • Return the totient value
  • Include optimization for prime numbers
tasks.hint: Use formula φ(n) = n × ∏(1 - 1/p) where p are distinct prime factors of n

tasks.title: Euler's Totient Properties
tasks.question:
What is the value of φ(p) for a prime number p?

Consider: Prime numbers have no factors other than 1 and themselves
tasks.hint: Think about how many numbers are coprime to a prime number
options: p - all numbers less than p are coprime
p-1 - all numbers from 1 to p-1 are coprime
p/2 - half the numbers are coprime

tasks.title: Modular Arithmetic Calculator
tasks.question:
Create a modular arithmetic calculator with advanced operations.

Your calculator should:

  • Perform modular addition, subtraction, multiplication
  • Calculate modular exponentiation efficiently
  • Find modular multiplicative inverse
  • Handle negative numbers and large values
  • Support Chinese Remainder Theorem
tasks.hint: Use properties of modular arithmetic, Fermat's Little Theorem for inverses, and binary exponentiation

exercises.title: Complex Financial Mathematics
exercises.description: Solve advanced financial calculations and investment problems.

tasks.title: Investment Portfolio Analyzer
tasks.question:
Create a comprehensive investment portfolio analysis system.

Your system should:

  • Calculate portfolio returns and risk metrics
  • Compute Sharpe ratio and beta values
  • Perform asset allocation optimization
  • Calculate correlation between assets
  • Generate risk-return analysis reports
tasks.hint: Use statistical formulas for returns, standard deviation for risk, and covariance for correlation
tasks.input: Stock A: 10% return, 15% risk; Stock B: 8% return, 12% risk; Correlation: 0.3

tasks.title: Sharpe Ratio Interpretation
tasks.question:
What does a Sharpe ratio of 1.5 indicate about an investment?

Consider: Sharpe ratio measures risk-adjusted returns
tasks.hint: Think about excess return per unit of risk
options: Good risk-adjusted performance - 1.5 units excess return per unit risk

tasks.title: Option Pricing Calculator
tasks.question:
Implement Black-Scholes option pricing model.

Your calculator should:

  • Calculate call and put option prices
  • Compute option Greeks (delta, gamma, theta, vega)
  • Handle dividend-paying stocks
  • Calculate implied volatility
  • Provide sensitivity analysis
tasks.hint: Use Black-Scholes formula with cumulative normal distribution, calculate partial derivatives for Greeks
